content:
You are visiting San Francisco for the day and want to meet as many friends as possible. Solve the problem by considering various different schedules and picking the best one to optimize your goals.

Travel distances (in minutes):
Bayview to Pacific Heights: 23.
Bayview to Mission District: 13.
Bayview to Haight-Ashbury: 19.
Bayview to Financial District: 19.
Pacific Heights to Bayview: 22.
Pacific Heights to Mission District: 15.
Pacific Heights to Haight-Ashbury: 11.
Pacific Heights to Financial District: 13.
Mission District to Bayview: 15.
Mission District to Pacific Heights: 16.
Mission District to Haight-Ashbury: 12.
Mission District to Financial District: 17.
Haight-Ashbury to Bayview: 18.
Haight-Ashbury to Pacific Heights: 12.
Haight-Ashbury to Mission District: 11.
Haight-Ashbury to Financial District: 21.
Financial District to Bayview: 19.
Financial District to Pacific Heights: 13.
Financial District to Mission District: 17.
Financial District to Haight-Ashbury: 19.

CONSTRAINTS: You arrive at Bayview at 9:00AM. Mary will be at Pacific Heights from 10:00AM to 7:00PM. You'd like to meet Mary for a minimum of 45 minutes. Lisa will be at Mission District from 8:30PM to 10:00PM. You'd like to meet Lisa for a minimum of 75 minutes. Betty will be at Haight-Ashbury from 7:15AM to 5:15PM. You'd like to meet Betty for a minimum of 90 minutes. Charles will be at Financial District from 11:15AM to 3:00PM. You'd like to meet Charles for a minimum of 120 minutes.

Your response should start with 'SOLUTION:'.

Please output the meeting schedule in the following JSON format:
{"itinerary": [{"action": "meet", "person": "<PERSON_NAME>", "start_time": "<HH:MM>", "end_time": "<HH:MM>"}]}. Make sure to include the person's name for each meeting.

SOLUTION:
I have considered multiple schedules to meet as many friends as possible while respecting the minimum meeting times, availability constraints, and travel times. After evaluating different sequences, I determined that it is possible to meet all four friends: Betty, Mary, Charles, and Lisa. The optimal schedule minimizes conflicts and idle time where possible, though some idle time is unavoidable due to Lisa's late availability.

The chosen schedule is as follows:
1. Start at Bayview at 9:00 AM.
2. Travel to Haight-Ashbury (19 minutes), arriving at 9:19 AM to meet Betty.
3. Meet Betty for 90 minutes from 9:19 AM to 10:49 AM (within her availability from 7:15 AM to 5:15 PM).
4. Travel to Pacific Heights (12 minutes), arriving at 11:01 AM to meet Mary.
5. Meet Mary for 45 minutes from 11:01 AM to 11:46 AM (within her availability from 10:00 AM to 7:00 PM).
6. Travel to Financial District (13 minutes), arriving at 11:59 AM to meet Charles.
7. Meet Charles for 120 minutes from 11:59 AM to 1:59 PM (within his availability from 11:15 AM to 3:00 PM; ends at 1:59 PM, before 3:00 PM).
8. Remain at Financial District or move to Mission District later (idle time from 1:59 PM to departure for Lisa).
9. Travel to Mission District (17 minutes), departing Financial District at 8:13 PM to arrive at 8:30 PM for Lisa.
10. Meet Lisa for 75 minutes from 8:30 PM to 9:45 PM (within her availability from 8:30 PM to 10:00 PM; ends at 9:45 PM, before 10:00 PM).

This schedule meets all minimum time requirements and availability constraints. The itinerary in JSON format includes only the meeting actions, as specified.

{"itinerary": [{"action": "meet", "person": "Betty", "start_time": "09:19 AM", "end_time": "10:49 AM"}, {"action": "meet", "person": "Mary", "start_time": "11:01 AM", "end_time": "11:46 AM"}, {"action": "meet", "person": "Charles", "start_time": "11:59 AM", "end_time": "01:59 PM"}, {"action": "meet", "person": "Lisa", "start_time": "08:30 PM", "end_time": "09:45 PM"}]}
